com.igormaznitsa.prol.io
Class ProlTextOutputStream

java.lang.Object
  com.igormaznitsa.prol.io.ProlTextOutputStream
All Implemented Interfaces:
ProlStream, ProlTextWriter
public class ProlTextOutputStream
extends java.lang.Object
implements ProlStream, ProlTextWriter

The class describes a text input stream which is used by a prol engine to write texts and chars into an input stream.

Author:
Igor Maznitsa (igor.maznitsa@igormaznitsa.com)
See Also:
ProlStream, ProlTextWriter

Constructor Detail

ProlTextOutputStream

protected ProlTextOutputStream(java.io.Writer writer,
                               ProlContext context,
                               boolean forAppend)
                        throws java.io.IOException
A constructor (it is used by memory pipes so it is protected one)

Parameters:
writer - a writer to be used to write chars into, must not be null
context - the owner context for the stream, must not be null
forAppend - usually the flag shows that we need to append data to current context but in the case the flag mainly doesn't play any role
Throws:
java.io.IOException - it will be thrown if there is any IO error during the operation

ProlTextOutputStream

public ProlTextOutputStream(java.lang.String resourceId,
                            ProlContext context,
                            boolean forAppend)
                     throws java.io.IOException
A constructor

Parameters:
resourceId - the resource id describes the resource used by the stream, must not be null
context - the owner context for the stream, must not be null
forAppend - if the flag is true then new data will be append to the current content of the resource, else the resource will be rewritten
Throws:
java.io.IOException - it will be thrown if there is any transport error during the operation
